headline: Warren Buffett Loves McDonalds And Coca-Cola But Scaled Back In Solidarity During His Wife's Oral Cancer Battle: 'I Won't Have Any Fun Either'
summary: Warren Buffett has never pretended to eat healthy. For decades, he's bragged about his love of McDonald's breakfasts, Dairy Queen sundaes, and five cans of Coca-Cola a day. "I checked the actuarial tables," he told Fortune in 2015, "and the lowest death rate is among six-year-olds. So I decided to eat like a six-year-old." But when his wife, Susie, was diagnosed with oral cancer, Buffett quietly changed everything. According to Alice Schroeder's biography "The Snowball: Warren Buffett and the Bu

headline: Can Coca-Cola's Emerging Market Growth Offset Flat U.S. Volume?
summary: KO taps strong emerging market growth in India, China and Africa to counter flat U.S. volume and mixed consumer sentiment.

headline: 3 High-Yield Dividend Stocks to Buy for the Second Half of 2025
summary: ExxonMobil has one of the most reliable dividends in the oil patch.  ConocoPhillips is putting its higher cash flow to work while managing risk.  Kinder Morgan's investment thesis has changed for the better.

headline: 2 Monster Stocks to Own for 10 Years or More
summary: Amazon's major segments all have massive growth runways, and the company has a wide moat.  Coca-Cola is a buy thanks to its stable business and incredible dividend program.  Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO)are two notable examples.

headline: Could Buying Coca-Cola Stock Today Set You Up for Life?
summary: Coca-Cola is one of the best-known consumer staples stocks on Wall Street.  The company has long been owned by Warren Buffett within Berkshire Hathaway's stock portfolio.  Coca-Cola has one big problem that investors need to consider carefully today before buying it.
